document.heading: Use of Trained Employees to Administer Medication Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 1999

history.narrative: Law 13-32, the “Use of Trained Employees to Administer Medication Clarification Temporary Amendment Act of 1999,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-228. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on May 4, 1999, and June 8, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on June 24, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-98 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-32 became effective on October 7, 1999.
